facts: The kangaroo has a card that is orange in color, has fourteen friends, is named Luna, and is holding her keys.
rules: Rule1: Regarding the kangaroo, if it has a card whose color is one of the rainbow colors, then we can conclude that it becomes an actual enemy of the turtle. Rule2: If the kangaroo does not have her keys, then the kangaroo becomes an enemy of the turtle. Rule3: If the kangaroo has fewer than 5 friends, then the kangaroo does not become an actual enemy of the turtle. Rule4: If the kangaroo has a name whose first letter is the same as the first letter of the baboon's name, then the kangaroo does not become an enemy of the turtle. Rule5: If the kangaroo becomes an actual enemy of the turtle, then the turtle is not going to owe money to the eagle.
preferences: Rule3 is preferred over Rule1. Rule3 is preferred over Rule2. Rule4 is preferred over Rule1. Rule4 is preferred over Rule2.
example: A few players are playing a boardgame. The current state of the game is as follows. The kangaroo has a card that is orange in color, has fourteen friends, is named Luna, and is holding her keys. And the rules of the game are as follows. Rule1: Regarding the kangaroo, if it has a card whose color is one of the rainbow colors, then we can conclude that it becomes an actual enemy of the turtle. Rule2: If the kangaroo does not have her keys, then the kangaroo becomes an enemy of the turtle. Rule3: If the kangaroo has fewer than 5 friends, then the kangaroo does not become an actual enemy of the turtle. Rule4: If the kangaroo has a name whose first letter is the same as the first letter of the baboon's name, then the kangaroo does not become an enemy of the turtle. Rule5: If the kangaroo becomes an actual enemy of the turtle, then the turtle is not going to owe money to the eagle. Rule3 is preferred over Rule1. Rule3 is preferred over Rule2. Rule4 is preferred over Rule1. Rule4 is preferred over Rule2. Based on the game state and the rules and preferences, does the turtle owe money to the eagle?
proof: We know the kangaroo has a card that is orange in color, orange is one of the rainbow colors, and according to Rule1 "if the kangaroo has a card whose color is one of the rainbow colors, then the kangaroo becomes an enemy of the turtle", and for the conflicting and higher priority rule Rule4 we cannot prove the antecedent "the kangaroo has a name whose first letter is the same as the first letter of the baboon's name" and for Rule3 we cannot prove the antecedent "the kangaroo has fewer than 5 friends", so we can conclude "the kangaroo becomes an enemy of the turtle". We know the kangaroo becomes an enemy of the turtle, and according to Rule5 "if the kangaroo becomes an enemy of the turtle, then the turtle does not owe money to the eagle", so we can conclude "the turtle does not owe money to the eagle". So the statement "the turtle owes money to the eagle" is disproved and the answer is "no".
